instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message: Happy Saturday! I got in an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with what I thought was no backlight, turns out there is no image. Looks like I am missing <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> which is at 0 volts. This board had some corrosion around the SMC as well as broken traces. Wouldn't Power on at all until I repaired all of the damage. When I plug in a USB Pen drive I get a solid light and nothing else. also nothing from external monitor via TB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message:
Reball SMC if corrosion near it.
USB mouse still gets light if disconnect/reconnect it?
Always better to test with pendrive OSX; if flashes, there is USB activity for sure.

3V3 must appears in the first seconds at pins 18/19 of J8300; even without LCD connected.
If LCD is connected, <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> must go high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message: Tested, and pins 18 and 19 stay at 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message:
Try to confirm if there is USB activity for sure.
Did you reball SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image
threads.message: No, going to reball SMC next. DOes the SMC have anything to do with video?
